Communication

Class SocketThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • Communication.SocketThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SocketThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements the dedicated server that controls all the communication between the client and the server.

    This class implements a runnable Thread that manages the communication between the client and the server. The main running cycle of this Thread is: - Wait # milliseconds. - Send the environment information to the client. - Ask the client for an Action to do. - Test the action and do it if possible. - Give feedback to the client about the Action returned. It also manages different events like the initial configuration after the Server class accepting the connection or the disconnection process.

    Version:
    v0.1 04/10/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres
    See Also:
    Action, Thread, Server, Socket
